review.title: Computation of Diet Composition for Patients Suffering from Kidney and Urinary Tract Diseases with the Fuzzy Genetic System
review.abstract: Determination of dietary food consumed a day for patients with diseases in general, greatly affect the health of the body and the healing process, is no exception for people with kidney disease and urinary tract. This paper presents the determination of diet composition in the form of food subtance for people with kidney and urinary tract diseases with a genetic fuzzy approach. This approach combines fuzzy logic and genetic algorithms, which utilizing fuzzy logic fuzzy tools and techniques to model the components of the genetic algorithm and adapting genetic algorithm control parameters, with the aim of improving system performance. The Mamdani fuzzy inference model and fuzzy rules based on population parameters and generation are used to determine the probability of crossover and mutation, and was using In this study, 400 food survey data along with their substances was used as test material. From the data, a varying amount of population is established. Each chromosome has 10 genes in which the value of each gene indicates the index number of foodstuffs in the database. The fuzzy genetic approach produces 10 best food substance and their compositions. The composition of these foods has nutritional value in accordance with the number of calories needed by people with kidney and urinary tract diseases by type of food.

metadata.title: Computation of Diet Composition for Patients Suffering from Kidney and Urinary Tract Diseases with the Fuzzy Genetic System

sections.text: This paper presents the determination of food composition in the form of food subtlety for people with kidney and urinary tract disease with a genetic fuzzy approach. This approach combines blurred logic and genetic algorithms that use blurred logical fuzzy tools and techniques to model the components of the genetic algorithm and adjust genetic algorithm control parameters to improve system performance. Mamdani fuzzy inference model and blurred rules based on population parameters and generation are used to determine the likelihood of crossover and mutation, and was used as test material in this study, 400 data from the food survey together with their substances, from which data is used to determine a different amount of population. Each chromosome has 10 genes in which the value of each gene indicates the index number of foods in the database.The blurred genetic approach produces 10 best composites of substances and the compositional composition of the foods required by the genetic composition of the foods.

sections.heading: 1. INTRODUCTION
sections.text: In fact, most of them are able to survive on their own.

sections.heading: 2. FUZZY GENETIC
sections.text: The fuzzification system developed here is a process that uses fuzzy rules to produce a fuzzy number as a result; the process of generating output from the fuzzy system is known as defuzcification. Mamdani's model was introduced in 1975 by Ebrahim Mamdani, also known as the Max Min Method. He uses Min for implication functions and Max for the composition between implication functions. The computing process is so complex that it takes a lot of time to make the result highly precise. First, the Genetic Algorithm (GA) is proposed by John Holland and his colleagues at the University of Michigan for the compilation of implication functions.

sections.heading: 3. THE NUTRIENT NEEDS FOR THOSE SUFFERING FROM KIDNEY AND URINARY TRACT DISEASES
sections.text: Nutrient is an organic substance needed by an organism to function normally, grow and stay healthy (1). Nutrition can be ingested by foods and beverages, which are then absorbed by the body. Nutrition research focuses on the effects of food and beverages on the body, especially in determining the optimal diet. A careful choice of daily diet will provide all the nutrients needed for the body to function normally. On the contrary, if food is not well chosen, people suffer from a lack of essential nutrients [11]. Nutritional needs are influenced by age, sex, physical activity and special conditions such as pregnancy and lactation. There are several ways to determine the number of basal metabolism (NBM), one of which is the Harris Benedict postulate [1] used in this research.

sections.heading: 4. THE PROPOSED MODEL
sections.text: It is not the first time that the EU Commission has taken such a step.

sections.heading: 4.1 General Explanation of the Model
sections.text: This year, it is more than ever before that it is a reactionary, reactionary and reactionary party.

sections.heading: 4.2 Test Results
sections.text: The process of genetic fuzzy system involves the use of fuzzy logic for determining the exact crossover and mutation probability according to the rules. The inferential system applied is Mamdanis model. The input parameters of the population is 100 and 150, meanwhile for the generation is 100, 800 and 1500. For a clearer explanation, see Table 5.As shown in the table, the best fitness function is printed in bold form. From the result of the three types of tests on each type of diet is chosen a parameter that can lead to the best fitness function. The test for nefrotic syndrome diet uses the population size of 150, crossover diet uses the probability of 0.6, mutation probability of 0.13 and generation maximum of 1500. The food index results from the experiment error test with the parameters 372, 72, 398, 196, 386, 344, 195, 109.

sections.heading: 5. CONCLUSION
sections.text: The real-life test cases show that genetic fuzzy algorithms can be applied to determine the composition of the optimal food ingredients to meet the nutritional needs of patients with kidney and urinary tract disease in one day. Diseases observed in this research include nefrotic syndrome, acute kidney failure, chronic kidney disease, the final stage of kidney disease and kidney stones. However, further research into expanding the disease database by including various other types of diseases, developing a user-friendly user interface and improving the method by combining other soft computing techniques are diseases required, building a user-friendly user interface and improving methods by combining the techniques of other soft computing.

sections.heading: 6. REFERENCES
sections.text: [1] Almatsier, p. 2008. Penuntun Diet. Gramedia PustakaUtama. Jakarta [2] Javadi, AA., Farmani, R. and Tan, TP. 2005. A HybridIntelligent Genetic Algorithm. Elsevier (19): 255-262. Paris [3] Palensky, M. and Ali, H. 2003. A Genetic Algorithm forSimplifying The Amino Acid Alphabet. IEEE Computer Society Bioinformatics Conference (CSB '03). California [4] Suer, G.A. and Allard, D. 2009. Fuzzy geneticscheduling with single and multiple schedulers, International Journal of Advanced Operations Management. Vol 1. 80 - 107. [5] Herrera, F. 2008. Genetic Fuzzy Systems: Taxonomy, Current Research Trends and Prospects.

The computing process is so complex and therefore needs to spend much time, which makes the result highly accurate [7].

Generally speaking, the genetic algorithm has 5 basic components, as stated by Michalewicz [9]: (a) A genetic representation of various solutions from a problem (b) A way to generate population initialization from various solutions (c) An evaluation of a solution function with a fitness score that belongs to each individual (d) Several genetic operators that divide several off springs during a reproduction process (e) A score for several parameters from the genetic algorithm The genetic algorithm is a computational model inspired by evolution process.
It can be applied in various complex fields, such as in engineering designs and modern operational system and a system as proposed by Ferentinos and Tsiligiridis [10].
